meanings.definition: The tendency to derive pleasure from one's own pain or humiliation.
meanings.sent1: Some people enjoy masochism by finding pleasure in their own pain.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't understand his masochism, why he enjoyed pain.
meanings.sent3: His masochism was evident when he laughed after stubbing his toe.
meanings.sent4: Her masochism was like a dark cloud following her, always seeking pain.
meanings.sent5: The masochism in him was like a hidden treasure, waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: The enjoyment of what appears to be painful or tiresome.
meanings.sent1: For some, masochism means finding joy in what seems painful.
meanings.sent2: Their masochism was evident in their love for challenging tasks.
meanings.sent3: The masochism of waiting in long lines for fun was lost on her.
meanings.sent4: His masochism for spicy food was like a fire burning inside him.
meanings.sent5: The masochism of running marathons was a mystery to many, but not to him.
